conclusion: Understand the electric field in a parallel-plate capacitor.
Electric field \( E \) is calculated as \( E = \frac{V}{d} \).
Relate potential difference to charge and capacitance.
Potential difference \( V \) is expressed as \( V = \frac{Q}{C} \).
Substitute \( V = \frac{Q}{C} \) into the electric field formula to get \( E = \frac{Q}{Cd} \).
Calculate the force on the point charge.
Force \( F \) is given by \( F = qE \).
Substitute \( E = \frac{Q}{Cd} \) into the force formula to get \( F = q \left( \frac{Q}{Cd} \right) \).
Simplify the expression to find \( F = \frac{qQ}{Cd} \).
Final answer: The magnitude of the electrostatic force is \( F = \frac{qQ}{Cd} \).
